chief sampson now has an update. remind people that the state of local emergency will be renewed later today. allows them to write orders where they need to and act hand in hand with other orders of government. #yyc #yeg #coronavirus
transit changes are coming up. fewer trips. physical distancing. half the seats on buses will be shut down. #yyc #yeg #coronavirus
have to change the etiquette on buses. tip on managing oneself in elevators: don't have to face straight on. limit numbers in elevators, sampson said. #yyc #yeg #coronavirus
avoid hitting the button with your hand. (same with beg buttons on street lamps...?) clean your phone after hitting these buttons with it. #yyc #yeg #coronavirus
also mentions people in playgrounds. says people are tearing signs down. it's not cool to cheat the system, said sampson. #yyc #yeg #coronavirus
blue bin recycling is the same. green recyling is around 21% lower. black carts down 9% volume. talking solid waste and recycling. #yyc #yeg #coronavirus

on calgary transit changes: seen 80% reduction in transit. changing service to maintain service coverage but respond to reduced volume. no routes are being cut, but you may need to wait longer in between rides. #yyc #yeg #coronavirus

there will be stickers and notification on the seats to remind people that others shouldn't sit there - physical distancing. low income passes and seniors pass - extending the grace period - pass in march will still be valid in may. #yyc #yeg #coronavirus
one of the challenges is that we're losing a lot of money, said nenshi. early estimates - $10 to 15m per week is being lost. #yyc #yeg #coronavirus

council will be talking about potential help for biz and citizens. problem for city is that they can't run a deficit at the end of the year. they have to balance the books dec. 31. #yyc #yeg #coronavirus
qs now. is there a target date for ending the local measures. no. no target date. #yyc #yeg #coronavirus

mayor nenshi said they've done a great job of readying the telus convention centre for the influx of calgary's homeless population. not the ideal solution for this, the mayor said, but it's what they're working with. #yyc #yeg #coronavirus
fyi - there's a media avail and tour of that space later this afternoon and we'll have something on that later today. video and photos. #yyc #yeg #coronavirus

q on firefighters on 24hour shift change. heard that today, too. there's constant cleaning going on, but they want to limit the contact between the different shifts (darren info, not from nenshi) nenshi: surprised to read about it in news today. #yyc #yeg #coronavirus
the $10 to 15m weekly reduction in city cash isn't a firm number - a rough estimate. but city also incurring other costs for ot and such along the way. #yyc #yeg #coronavirus
some increase in cps domestic challenges, but not in property crimes. really proud with the way calgarians have been acting right now, said chief tom sampson. #yyc #yeg #coronavirus
i asked a handful of questions in there, so i didn't exactly livetweet. will catch you up in a bit. briefing over now. #yyc #yeg #coronavirus
daily #coronavirus briefing with dr. deena hinshaw should start momentarily. will keep you in the loop as best i can. #yyc #yeg #covid19ab
starting today with premier jason kenney. #yyc #yeg #coronavirus 117 cases, 871 total in alberta. large jump is due to backlog tests processed, said kenney.

two more people have died as a result of the #coronavirus. this has been the toughest week of the pandemic for our province, said premier kenney. the hard truth is things will get worse before they get better. #yyc #yeg

only 2% of tests have come back with positive results, said premier kenney. based on trajectory - confident they have health care professionals and equipment to handle the cases. #yyc #yeg #coronavirus
142 people have recovered so far, premier kenney said. #yyc #yeg #coronavirus

call to action for alberta's truck drivers. dozens of trucks going back and forth on qe2. all of them carrying essential goods that albertans need, said kenney. he salues truck drivers under trying circumstances. #yyc #yeg #coronavirus
show some basic decency and basic consideration, premier kenney said as they open up highway rest stops. he said people were stealing sanitary supplies at those locations. #yyc #yeg #coronavirus
more child care spaces are being opened up for more essential services workers. #yyc #yeg #coronavirus expanding eligibility for these workers.
optimistic in expedited program for oil well reclamation, said premier kenney. #yyc #yeg #coronavirus
now dr. hinshaw. says other health care is still going on: babies, essential surgeries, people being injured. everyone will get care. #yyc #yeg #coronavirus

the new amount of cases is the result of 4500 tests being done. these numbers may seem alarming, said dr. hinshaw. only 2% came back positive. 94 of total cases community transmission. increase of 24. #yyc #yeg #coronavirus

male in his 80s in north zone and male in his 80s in calgary zone were the most recent deaths. dr. hinshaw extends her condolences to the families. my greatest concern is for those in continuing care and those in congregated settings. #yyc #yeg #coronavirus
alberta health services is working with all the long term care centres. updated health rules, cleaning and screening of staff required at these locations. #yyc #yeg #coronavirus
it's just as necessary to take care of your overall health. heard concerns that people are concerned about raising their health issues due to concerns over #coronavirus. #yyc #yeg
(that's lots of concerns in that last tweet.) #yyc #yeg #coronavirus

increase in the number of prescriptions that are potential 'treatments' for covid-19. this is inappropriate, said dr. hinshaw. no robust evidence on treatment using many of these prescriptions. #yyc #yeg #coronavirus
no vaccine or proven treatment for covid-19. instead: stay home if you're sick. physical distance. support each other where possible. #yyc #yeg #coronavirus

q: on education cuts. promised full funding would be there. two weeks later we're cutting. somethign specific happen? a: we continued to offer education support, said premier kenney. all specialized supports will remain. #yyc #yeg #coronavirus
nutrition funding is still available and schools can offer, or divert funding to local non-profit to help. #yyc #yeg #coronavirus

on layoffs: 100s of thousands of people are losing jobs across all industries. biz owners are unsure if they'll lose everything or be able to open again. premier said when schools restart, most of the laid off ed staff will get jobs back. #yyc #yeg #coronavirus
on ppe for frontline health: three to four month supply. slightly less for n95 masks. sufficient supplies currently, said ahs dr. mark joffe. #yyc #yeg #coronavirus

looking at innovative forms or 'domestic procurement' of some of the ppe. i can think of a few of these places. why they wouldn't take them up on this immediately, i don't know. #yyc #yeg #coronavirus
premier goes back to ed layoffs. said most are being paid to the end of april. six weeks more notice than most of the private sector. #yyc #yeg #coronavirus

oh. rick bell v dr hinshaw. should albertans think, hey it's a backlog, we just made up a backlog... giving the dr 'a chance' what should they see? #yyc #yeg #coronavirus they should be concerned, said dr. hinshaw. #yyc #yeg #coronavirus

looking at last several days of data. hopefully in the coming days she'll be able to tell us what the data means. focus on areas. people should be as concerned about the number of cases today, as they were before. #yyc #yeg #coronavirus
sorry - but not sure why the premier is getting in on this question, but mr. bell also asked the premier if he should answer the question. #yyc #yeg #coronavirus
in other news, record number of people staying home during #coronavirus pandemic. #yyc #yeg

moving on.... i'm particular about this stuff. q came through for 'deena hinshaw.' it's dr. deena hinshaw. it's premier jason kenney. it's minister rebecca schulz respect the position. #yyc #yeg #coronavirus

re: can you use household bleach products or alcohol mixed with water to make your own hand sanitizer? instead of worrying about homemade sanitizer, washing your hands is the most effective thing you can do. soap works better than hand sanitizer. - dr. rimoin #coronavirus

medical masks are for medical personnel only. no need for the general public to be using. wearing a face covering (bandana, scarf, handmade masks, etc.) is about keeping your droplets to yourself and is a good idea bc of asymptomatic transmission. - dr. rimoin #coronavirus
masks will not protect you from getting #coronavirus, it is about protecting others from getting your germs, in case you are asymptomatic and sick - #dr. rimoin
the truth of the matter is we are behind the curve, and we are trying to get ahead of it as fast as we can. - dr. rimoin. #coronavirus
